description.narrative: Continuation of the Stabilization of Roma Ashkalia Egyptian Communities in Roma Mahalla in Mitrovica 2014-2018
Continuation of the Stabilization of Roma Ashkalia Egyptian Communities in Roma Mahalla in Mitrovica 2014-2018

The objective of this interevntion is to empower Mitrovicë/a Roma, Ashkalia and Egyptian communities, women, men, girls and boys, in a process that enhances their stabilisation and integration while assisting the municipality in assuming their responsibilities towards its citizens, contributing to the communities’ equality in respect to the rest of Kosovo citizens while progressively ensuring independence from external (international) aid. The project was designed into four complementing activity areas applying five perspectives on development effectiveness. Rights perspective principles as non-discrimination policies, participation, transparency and accountability is reflected in creating enabling environment for women and men boys and girls to participate in the public meetings, capacity development activities/professional courses, education classes, business opportunities and cultural and sport activities. -Conflict perspective - very complex situation in the North of Kosovo and especially in Mitrovica town required multifaceted approach and commitment of all stakeholders. DRC provided physical security and inclusive safe space for target communities for implementation of project activities. - Poor people perspective - the project addressed and worked towards improved literacy level and employability opportunities for RAE communities with specific focus on opportunities for women and girls. The intervention addressed also underlying causes of poverty, such as traditional customs on the women's stereotypical role for the household and for the family responsibilities; such as care for children and elderly. -Gender perspective - women and girls were supported with specific affirmative measures and interventions necessary for their empowerment. - Environment - Project activities has led to greater awareness on protection of environment; frequent activities and also recycling start up business activities were financially supported. Increased ownership of the project started at the inception phase of this project, during the data collection activities where targeted communities and local stakeholders participated actively, subsequently they provided primary inputs for the project planning process.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This development intervention has achieved indended outcomes as follows> Comprehensive and reliable data is available on the needs, capacities and expectations of Mitrovicë/a RAE communities, including their perceived level of integration. Different groups within Mitrovicë/a Roma, Ashkalia Egyptian communities have received support in boosting their education level and consequent access to the opportunities available to all Kosovo citizens. The Social Business Incubator is enhanced in terms of the benefits it brings to Roma, Ashkalia and Egyptian communities and it is institutionalised through a public-private partnership. RAE communities have developed their individual and collective (non-technical) capacities to foster their socio-economic development (lateral thinking, innovation…), including ways to establish linkages to the opportunities offered by the authorities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
